results.title: Packages from home
results.creator_credit: Dave Piggott, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Dave Piggott went to fight in the Vietnam War at 19, it was a very different world to life back in Australia. With the help of the friends he made in the army, he soon got used to life there and it’s the funny stories and good friends that remain with him today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Piggott, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Reminiscing
results.creator_credit: Alf Thornton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alf Thornton fondly recalls his time serving in the Australian Navy during World War II, when letting your mates down was more feared than being killed. When Thornton returned, he spent most of his time trying to regain his lost youth but eventually found an anchor on the H.M.A.S. Castlemaine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alf Thornton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Alf Thornton fondly recalls his time serving in the Australian Navy during World War II, when letting your mates down was more feared than being killed. When Thornton returned, he spent most of his time trying to regain his lost youth but eventually found an anchor on the H.M.A.S. Castlemaine.
description_for_label: Alf Thornton fondly recalls his time serving in the Australian Navy during World War II, when letting your mates down was more feared than being killed. results.title: The Lost Thing: character
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘The Lost Thing’ production team discusses the challenges they faced creating the friendly and unthreatening character of the lost thing and the techniques used to convey emotion in a character that does not speak and has no facial features.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI

results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
description_for_label: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
